However, the series has not been renewed for a 10th Season, so there's a chance that the 9th Season will be the last opportunity for fans to see James Spader as former government agent Raymond "Red" Reddington.

headings.heading: Ozark
headings.content:
Jason Bateman, Laura Linney, and Julia Garner are just a few of the major stars on Netflix's Ozark. The hit drama will officially be ending in 2022 with its fourth and final season.
The fourth season will be split into two parts with the first airing on January 21, 2022.
This Adult Swim comedy is finally going away in 2022. Find out what it is...

headings.heading: Peaky Blinders
headings.content:
Peaky Blinders is a BBC period piece that takes place shortly after World War I. It centers on a family involved in organized crime.
The show will be ending in 2022 with its sixth and final season. Many critics favor Peaky Blinders for its writing, acting, visuals, and "stylish" cinematography.

headings.heading: Family Reunion
headings.content:
Some may remember '90s teen star Tia Mowry-Hardrict from her hit show, Sister, Sister, with twin sister Tamara Mowry-Housley. Now, the twin sisters have branched out with their own shows.
Tia's series, Family Reunion, premiered on Netflix in 2019, but will be ending in 2022. The show is about a family who goes to a family reunion, but end up staying longer than they expected.

headings.heading: Wu-Tang: An American Saga
headings.content:
Wu-Tang: An American Saga is a drama series about the formation of the hip hop group, Wu-Tang Clan. The Hulu series will air its third and final season in 2022.
The show stars Ashton Sanders, Shameik Moore, Erika Alexander, and more. The top review on IMDb wrote that the show brings a lot of depth to the band members.

headings.heading: Trickster
headings.content:
Trickster is a coming-of-age supernatural thriller drama series that airs on The CW. The show is an adaptation of Eden Robinson's 2017 novel Son of a Trickster.
Trickster was cancelled after its first season with the last episode airing in 2022. The series was originally going to get another season, but the network decided to go in a different direction.

headings.heading: Squidbillies
headings.content:
Squidbillies is an animated series aimed at adults on Cartoon Network's Adult Swim. The series began in 2005, but will be ending after 13 seasons in 2022.
Squidbillies is about a family of hillbilly mud squids who live in the Blue Ridge Mountains in Georgia. Some famous guest stars have included Fred Armisen, Rachel Dratch, and Patton Oswalt.

headings.heading: The Unicorn
headings.content:
Walton Goggins, Rob Corddry, Omar Miller, and more starred on the CBS sitcom The Unicorn. The series was cancelled as part of the 2021-2022 season.
The Unicorn was about a recently widowed father of two daughters who tries to start dating again. He soon becomes one of the most sought-after dates in his area.

headings.heading: Prodigal Son
headings.content:
Prodigal Son was officially cancelled after its second season on Fox. It ran for 33 episodes and starred Tom Payne, Michael Sheen, Lou Diamond Phillips, and Halston Sage.
The show centers on the son of a serial killer who is dealing with the aftermath of helping the police send him to prison.
After only one season, Apple TV+ cancelled this highly-anticipated series.

headings.heading: United We Fall
headings.content:
As part of the 2021-2022 season, ABC cancelled the sitcom United We Fall after only eight episodes. The show starred Will Sasso, Christina Vidal Mitchell, Jane Curtin, and more.
United We Fall was about a couple with young children who have to deal with their overbearing extended family. Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 40 percent rating.

headings.heading: Mr. Corman
headings.content:
Joseph Gordon-Levitt released his show, Mr. Corman, on Apple TV+. Not only was he the main character, but he also was the creator, writer, and director.
Apple TV+ chose to not renew the show for another season in 2022. Mr. Corman followed an elementary school teacher who struggled with identity, anxiety, and relationships.

headings.heading: Arthur
headings.content:
The PBS children's series, Arthur, will finally be ending in 2022. The show premiered on October 7, 1996, so it will be the longest-running children's animated series in the United States.
It's also the second longest-running animated series in history after The Simpsons. Even though this show is aimed at children, it has touched on serious topics such as asthma, diabetes, dyslexia, and more.

headings.heading: The Owl House
headings.content:
While Disney Channel's The Owl House has made television history, it was announced that the animated children's series would be ending in 2022 after its third season.
The Owl House has been praised for it's LGBTQ+ representation, including being the first Disney program to include a same-sex couple in leading roles.

headings.heading: Black Monday
headings.content:
After three seasons, Showtime's Black Monday is finally coming to an end. Don Cheadle earned several lead actor Emmy nominations for his role of Maurice Monroe.
The series took viewers back to the 80s during the Black Monday Wall Street stock market crash. Black Monday received mixed reviews from critics who loved the cast, but thought it lacked substance.
Read on to discover which Peacock mystery series got canceled after one season...

headings.heading: Work In Progress
headings.content:
Showtime's Work in Progress will officially be ending after two seasons. The series starred Abby McEnany as a lesbian working through mental health issues.
Rotten Tomatoes gave Work in Progress an 100 percent critical approval rating saying, "As radically hilarious as it is relatably uncomfortable, Work in Progress is a stunning debut from co-creator and star Abby McEnany."

headings.heading: American Rust
headings.content:
Set in a small Pennsylvania town, American Rust follows a chief of police (Jeff Daniels) who leads an investigation when the son of the woman he loves is accused of a serious crime.
After one season, American Rust was canceled by Showtime. Critics liked the cast, but thought the narrative wasn't clear.

headings.heading: Dan Brown's The Lost Symbol
headings.content:
The Peacock series Dan Brown's The Lost Symbol will not be moving forward with a second season. The plot was a prequel to The Da Vinci Code and followed a young CIA agent solving crime after his mentor went missing.
Rotten Tomatoes gave the show a 50 percent rating and thought the writing and pace made it fall flat.

headings.heading: Small Fortune
headings.content:
Small Fortune was an NBC game show hosted by Lil Rel Howery, but the series was not picked up for a second season.
Contestants would test their skills on miniature playing fields such as a shrunken sushi conveyer belt and mini Ellis Island. Small Fortune averaged a little under 1.5 million viewers per episode.

headings.heading: Pooch Perfect
headings.content:
Pitch Perfect star Rebel Wilson hosted a dog grooming competition show called Pooch Perfect on ABC. Contestants would try and win a giant cash prize.
The celebrity judges included Lisa Vanderpump, Jorge Bendersky, and Dr. Callie Harris. After being one of the network's lowest-rated shows of 2021, it will not be moving forward with another season.
Coming up: Find out which popular game show isn't returning for a fifth season!

headings.heading: Bull
headings.content:
After six seasons on CBS, the legal drama Bull will not be returning in 2022. The series followed the employees at a jury consulting firm, which is headed by a psychologist and trial-science expert named Dr. Jason Bull (Michael Weatherly).
Critics were fans of Weatherly's performance, but thought the show relied too heavily on legal show tropes.

headings.heading: Bringing Up Bates
headings.content:
After the success of similar TLC family shows, UPtv decided to make Bringing Up Bates. The series will finally be ending after 10 seasons.
UPtv decided to cancel the show because the network wants to focus more on movies and scripted series for 2022. An eleventh season was filmed, but will not air.

headings.heading: Ellen's Game Of Games
headings.content:
Not only is Ellen DeGeneres ending her hit daytime talk show, but she also decided not to return for a fifth season of Ellen's Game of Games.
The game show featured larger-than-life and colorful versions of games that had previously been featured on her talk show with contestants competing for $100,000.

title: Photos That Beautifully Sum Up The Life Of Actress Salma Hayek
intro: Born in Coatzacoalcos, Mexico, Salma Hayek is one of the most successful actresses in the world. She's shined in projects such as Desperado, 30 Rock, Grown Ups, and works as a producer, too. Fans will want to look through these gorgeous photos of Hayek both on and off-screen.

headings.heading: She Made Oscars History
headings.content: One of the movies Salma Hayek is best known for is the titular role in 2002's Frida. Her stellar performance earned her a Best Actress Academy Award nomination.Hayek was only the second Latina actress to receive this honor. She was nominated for several other awards for the role including a BAFTA, Golden Globe, and SAG Award.

headings.heading: She's A Mexican Soccer Fan
headings.content:
Hayek was born and raised in Mexico, so she still has interests that bring her back to her roots. During her free time, she loves to watch Mexican soccer matches.
Her husband is a huge soccer fan as well, so it's something the two of them are able to bond over.

headings.heading: She Was Expelled From Catholic School
headings.content:
While the star claims she has a good sense of humor, there were moments in her life where it got the better of her.
When she was 12-years-old, she attended a U.S. boarding school and was known to pull pranks. For example, she would set all the clocks back to mess with the other students. These types of pranks led to her expulsion from the school.

headings.heading: She Loves To Cook And Create Her Own Recipes
headings.content:
Not every celebrity has the time and energy to cook, but Salma Hayek absolutely loves it. During an interview with Good Housekeeping, she spoke about her cooking methods.
"I like to invent dishes all the time. I'm getting really creative with quinoa," said Hayek. She also mentioned that coconut water, chili sauce, and tortillas are always in her refrigerator.

headings.heading: She Loves Old Hollywood Films
headings.content:
While Salma Hayek is one of Hollywood's top leading ladies, she still loves to go back to the classics.
Some of her favorite vintage Hollywood films include Casablanca, Gone with the Wind, The Graduate, and It Happened One Night. It's only fitting that she gets some inspiration from some of Hollywood's most famous works.

headings.heading: She Started A Production Company
headings.content:
Salma Hayek was always looking for the best parts and got used to not getting the offers she wanted. She decided it was time to take matters into her own hands.
In 1999, she founded her own film production company called Ventanarosa, which specializes in film and television projects. Her first film as a producer was nominated for an Oscar.

headings.heading: Stepping Into Showbusiness
headings.content:
Fans of Hayek often want to know how she got started in showbusiness. During an interview with W magazine, she talked about her very first audition.
When she was 18-years-old, she auditioned for the role of Jasmine in a local production of Aladdin and won the part. She was extremely nervous throughout the entire process and didn't enjoy the experience.

headings.heading: Her First Celebrity Crush
headings.content:
Hayek came of age during the late '70s and early '80s, so her first celebrity crush was one of the biggest heartthrobs of that era.
In an interview, she revealed that her very first celebrity crush, like many, was Scott Baio, aka Chachi Arcola on Happy Days.

headings.heading: She Adopted An Owl
headings.content:
Hayek and her husband Francois-Henri Pinault like to keep things interesting. When Hayek saw an ad for an owl, she knew it would be the perfect gift for him.
She gave the owl to him on Valentine's Day and the couple named it after Pinault's luxury goods brand called Kering.

headings.heading: She Has A Secret Talent
headings.content:
When Hayek became a new mother, and had a young child to take care of, she looked for something to keep her mind sharp.
She soon discovered the game of Sudoku and ended up becoming pretty good at it. "I can do it sometimes in four minutes. The machine tells me I'm good at Sudoku, that's how I found out," she said to W magazine.

headings.heading: She Has Tons Of Pets
headings.content:
Not only did Selma Hayek adopt an owl for her husband, but she is also the owner of dozens of other pets.
She has an animal sanctuary with most of the pets being homeless rescues she found on the street. Some of the pets include dogs, horses, alpacas, bunnies, and chickens.

headings.heading: Her Parents Didn't Shy Away From Fame
headings.content:
While Salma Hayek has an impressive film and producing career, her parents were also pretty well-known.
Her father, Sami Hayek Domínguez, was a successful businessman who ran for mayor of her hometown of Coatzacoalcos, Mexico. Her mother, Diana Jiménez Medina, was an opera singer and talent scout who encouraged her daughter to become an actress.

headings.heading: Her Grandmother Used An Old Wive's Tale On Hayek To Thicken Her Hair
headings.content:
Those who knew Selma Hayek when she was a child admitted that she wasn't known for her good looks back then.
Her grandmother wanted to help, so she would regularly shave Hayek's head and eyebrows in order for the hair to grow back thicker. Whether or not this helped is still unknown.
Do you remember Hayek's very first acting role? Keep reading to find out.

headings.heading: She Has Some Learning Disabilities
headings.content:
While Hayek was in school, she realized that something wasn't right. She was diagnosed with ADHD and dyslexia when she was around 12-years-old.
These learning disabilities made it difficult for her to focus on her studies and process languages. Also, this was before she had to learn a second language.

headings.heading: She Wanted To Be A Gymnast
headings.content:
Many actors think about the possibility of other career paths. When Salma Hayek was a child, her dream was to be a gymnast.
She was so good that she was drafted for the Olympic team, but family obligations prevented her from pursuing it further. Hayek was actually self-taught because she couldn't find any classes in her area.

headings.heading: She Didn't Always Feel Beautiful
headings.content:
Throughout her career, Salma Hayek is known for having a practically flawless appearance. This wasn't always the case.
During her 20s, Hayek's skin suffered from terrible acne, which also took a toll on her mental health. Her acne was so bad that she often felt depressed about her outward appearance.

headings.heading: Her First Professional Acting Gig
headings.content:
Before she became a Hollywood star, Salma Hayek began her acting career in Mexico. She landed her first acting role on a telenovela series called Teresa when she was 23-years-old.
The role made her famous in Mexico and it wasn't long before she started getting cast in movies in Los Angeles.

headings.heading: Her Husband Is Extremely Wealthy
headings.content:
Salma Hayek married French businessman, François-Henri Pinault, on Valentine's Day 2009 in Paris. Those who've heard of Pinault may know of his financial success.
The 59-year-old is a billionaire and his father, François Pinault, is one of the richest men in the world. François-Henri Pinault is the chairman and CEO of Kering and president of Groupe Artémis.

headings.heading: Designers Didn't Want To Work With Her
headings.content:
Before Salma Hayek became a household name, she was determined to become a Hollywood starlet. Early on in her career, she admitted that she couldn't find any dress or jewelry designers who wanted to work with her.
Hayek would have to get creative with her looks and even used temporary tattoos in one instance to make herself stand out.

headings.heading: She Had A Stalker
headings.content:
Courtroom documents from 2015 were found stating that Selma Hayek needed to take out a restraining order. A woman had been stalking and harassing her, which intensely scared Hayek.
The woman would impersonate her, contact her family, and follow her around. This was enough for Hayek to take legal action against her.

headings.heading: Adam Sandler Stood Up For Her
headings.content:
Selma Hayek starred opposite Adam Sandler in both Grown Ups and Grown Ups 2 films. However, executives weren't sure she was right for the part.
Sandler told the executives that he had hand-picked Hayek for the role and that he did not want them to bring up the matter again.

headings.heading: She Dated Edward Norton
headings.content:
One of Salma Hayek's most famous boyfriends was actor Edward Norton. One of her best moments with Norton was working with him on Frida.
Hayek wasn't happy with the script, so Norton took it upon himself to rewrite the entire movie for free. Even after they dated, Hayek still refers to him as an "angel."
Coming up: This is what Selma Hayek does when she's not acting...

headings.heading: She Made Up The Snake Dance In From Dusk Till Dawn
headings.content:
Britney Spears isn't the only female celebrity to dance with a snake. In 1996, she had a brief role in From Dusk till Dawn as a vampire queen.
She performed a table-top snake dance that ended up being completely improvised. Her only direction was to "feel the music" and to keep dancing until the director stopped her.

headings.heading: She Is A Strong Supporter Of Feminism
headings.content:
When Hayek isn't working in the entertainment industry, she devotes her time to philanthropic work. She chooses causes that support feminism such as increasing awareness of violence against women.
Hayek wants to create more opportunities for Latina women in Hollywood as well. Other causes near and dear to her heart include global health care and climate change.

headings.heading: She Only Exercises For Five Minutes Per Day
headings.content:
While some may think Selma Hayek spends hours at the gym to maintain her physique, they would be wrong. Hayek admitted she only works out for five minutes each day.
She prefers to do Krav Maga, a military self-defence fighting technique used by the Israel Defense Forces. These exercises include boxing, wrestling, judo, karate, and more.

headings.heading: The Meaning Behind Her Name
headings.content:
Some may consider Salma to be a unique name because it isn't seen that often. The name actually means peace in Arabic.
Also, Hayek has a daughter named Valentina who was born on September 21, 2007. Her daughter's name could be a nod to her wedding being on Valentine's Day.

headings.heading: What Inspired Her To Act
headings.content:
While Salma Hayek's mother worked in showbusiness, she had other inspirations for why she wanted to become an actress.
When she was a child she became enamored with Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. The performances in that film helped her come to the conclusion that she wanted to act for a living.

headings.heading: Her Most Important Skincare Tip
headings.content:
Salma Hayek wasn't always blessed in the skincare department. During her 20s, she suffered from extremely bad acne.
After a few decades, she was able to figure out the best tips for her skin. "Never go to sleep without washing your face, no matter how tired you are," she said during an interview with InStyle.

headings.heading: She Refuses To Dye Her Hair
headings.content:
Hollywood is a hard place to work, especially for women. While Salma Hayek is known for her looks, she doesn't want to alter them.
"I don't dye [my hair] because I am curious to see how I am going to look with this. I don't have any Botox. I am comfortable in my own skin," she told Holmes Place.

headings.heading: She Graduated High School Early
headings.content:
While Selma Hayek was expelled from Catholic school, she was still able to continue her education and graduated from high school by the time she was 15.
She later went on to study international relations at the prestigious Universidad Iberoamericana in Mexico, but dropped out to focus on her acting career.

title: Incredible Car Trivia That Puts Things Into Perspective
intro: You may know who made the first car but do you know how many parts there are in a car? Don't worry if you don't! This post is all about car facts. Not raw, senseless facts that you cannot fathom, no. In this listicle, we will help you visualize some of the weirdest car facts and stats.

headings.heading: Toyota Sells Four Corollas Every Minute
headings.content: The Toyota Corolla is the best-selling car of all time. Toyota has sold more than 46 million of these cars over the nameplate's production run. But what do 46 million cars look like? Let's break that down to understand it better.According to Toyota Global, 5,850 Corollas are sold every single day. That means Toyota is averaging a Corolla sale every 15 seconds, with 4 people driving off the showroom floor with a brand new Corolla every minute.

headings.heading: There Are as Many Cars in the World as There Are Cattle
headings.content:
Here's an interesting car fact that also involves cattle! We now have more vehicles than domestic cows in the world.
As of 2020, there are around 1 billion domestic cattle all around the world. Cars? We have an estimated 1.44 billion vehicles driving around the roads of the planet. That speaks of how much we want to move around compared to how much beef we have to eat.

headings.heading: An F1 Car Costs More Than a Private Jet
headings.content:
Ever heard of the little cars that drivers race around circuits all around the world? Those weird ones with no roof or doors, or anything? They pretty much look like a driver is strapped to an engine.
These cars are the absolute epitome of automotive engineering and cost a fortune to make. How much? Well, the exact prices are not revealed but estimates put the worth of one of these at $12.2 million. For reference, a Honda Jet will cost you just under $5 million.

headings.heading: There is a Car That can Go 0-300mph in 4 Seconds
headings.content:
You might be excited to own a Dodge Demon or Tesla Model S Plaid because those things accelerate crazy fast, right? Well, they are nothing compared to the fastest accelerating cars. There are race cars, called Top Fuel Dragsters, which can accelerate from 0 to 300mph+ in under 4 seconds.
The engines of these cars produce 10,000hp and the forces acting on the internals of the engines are of such monstrous proportions that an engine typically lasts one run. What's even crazier is the fact that specialized mechanics rebuild the engine at the race venue in under 40 minutes.
The fastest car is not the one you think. Keep reading to know!

headings.heading: An F1 Driver Earns More Than 1,000 US Citizens
headings.content:
Remember the crazy expensive cars we just talked about? Well, the people who drive them earn a crazy lot of money. By a lot, I mean more than we, commoners, can ever begin to imagine.
Lewis Hamilton, the lead driver of the Mercedes AMG Petronas F1 team, who drives this car, has a base salary of $55 million. For reference, the average income of an American citizen is around $52,000. That works out to be 1,059 times the income of an average American. That's still not counting the estimated $7 million he'll earn in bonuses for winning races this season.

headings.heading: There's a Toyota that Cleans the Air as it Drives
headings.content:
Toyota has a fuel cell electric vehicle called the Mirai. It works by combining hydrogen and oxygen to produce electricity that powers the motors to move the wheels.
This setup, obviously, does not produce any emissions and the by-product of this process is just water. What's amazing is that it uses a filter to screen out any particle over 3 microns in size from the atmospheric air that it takes in to extract oxygen. The gauge cluster  even shows how much air the car has cleaned so far.

headings.heading: The Most Expensive Car Ever Was Sold For $44 Million
headings.content:
If you think a Ferrari Pininfarina Battista is too expensive, wait till you know about the price of this 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO. It made headlines for being the most expensive car to be sold ever in 2017.
It was bought by British car collector Gregor Fisken for $44 million from Washington DC-based lawyer Bernard Carl.  For reference, you can buy a 5-bed apartment in the world's highest building, Burj Khalifa, for just $10 million. How can this car, or any car for that matter, be worth FOURTY FOUR MILLION DOLLARS?

headings.heading: Volkswagen is the Parent Company of 12 Car Brands
headings.content:
It might not make you feel very good but many of the parts in your Audi S8 might also be present in the Volkswagen Passat. Or to feel good, you can consider that many of your car's parts are shared by a Bentley.
That is because German conglomerate Volkswagen Group owns ŠKODA, SEAT, CUPRA, Audi, Lamborghini, Bentley, Porsche, and motorcycle brand Ducati. They also owned Bugatti up until a few weeks back.
Keep reading to be blown away by who owns Bugatti now.

headings.heading: The First Hybrid Car was Made 60 Years Before the Seatbelt Was Invented
headings.content:
If you think that the Toyota Prius that debuted in 1999 was the first hybrid car, you could not be more wrong. The first hybrid car was designed by the founder of the sports car brand Porsche, Ferdinand Porsche.
The Lohner-Porsche Mixte was made in 1899 and was so well received by the public that Porsche made 300 examples of it. 300 was a pretty big number for 1899. For comparison, the modern three-point seatbelt we are all used to today was developed by Volvo engineer Nils Bohlin in 1959.

headings.heading: Lamborghini was Originally a Tractor Company
headings.content:
Who does not like the classic roar of a Lamborghini V12? How about the fact that this supercar company started as a tractor maker? Ferruccio Lamborghini, the man who founded Lamborghini Tractor Company was a customer of Ferrari, that's where it started.
In 1963, Ferruccio went to Enzo Ferrari to complain about the many faults in his cars, aka Ferraris. Enzo reportedly made fun of Ferruccio, saying that a tractor manufacturer has no business telling him how to make cars. Ferruccio being an honorable Italian took that as a challenge and ended up making Ferrari's archrival, Automobili Lamborghini.

headings.heading: Jaguar and Land Rover are Not Owned by a Brit
headings.content:
Jaguar and Land Rover are British brands, right? Well, partially! It was 2008 when these two brands were struggling against the worst odds and a man from India came forward as the savior, Ratan Tata.
Ratan was the chief executive of Tata Sons, one of the biggest Indian companies, at that time. Ratan purchased Land Rover and Jaguar in 2008 and combined them into Jaguar Land Rover Limited in 2013.

headings.heading: SSC Tuatara is Not the Fastest Production Car in the World
headings.content:
The Tuatara, a car made by SSC North America was recently claimed to be the fastest car in the world with a top speed of 316.7mph. But after the backlash from people who dissected their claimed top speed run, SSC North America has finally acknowledged that their record was not true.
That means the fastest production car in the world is still the Bugatti Chiron Super Sport. This 1,600hp street-legal freak of a car can rip a hole through time at 304mph, thanks to the gigantic 8.0 liter quad-turbocharged W-16 engine.
Do you know how much power the Chiron has? The true scale of that is coming up!

headings.heading: You Can Fence a Football Field Five Times with the Wires in an Average Car
headings.content:
Modern cars depend on electronics for a lot of things. Even the accelerator pedal has no direct mechanical contact with the throttle body. An electric wire carries signals from the potentiometer in the gas pedal to the throttle body. That's just one example.
To maintain all the electric connections in a modern car, a lot of wiring is needed. An average of 5,000 feet of wire is used in a car. That is enough wire to go around the entire perimeter of a football field 5 times.

headings.heading: An Average Car has More Parts than all Cities, Towns, and Villages in the US Combined
headings.content:
Cars are made up of a lot of parts, but how many to be exact? Well, that varies from car to car but an average figure for the number of parts in a car stands at 30,000.
To better understand that number, consider this; there are 19,495 cities, towns, and villages combined in the US. These even include the ones with a population under 5,000. So, if you disassemble a car and send one part to every human settlement in the US, you'd still have, like, half a car.

headings.heading: A Car's Engine Revs 1 Billion Times in its Lifetime
headings.content:
The engine in your car is constantly revving when it is turned on. No matter if it is cruising, racing, or just idling, the engine is in constant motion. What we fail to appreciate is how much an engine actually revs.
If we assume that a car is driven at 70mph for the entirety of its 200,000 miles age, a car's engine will go through more than 1 billion revolutions over the course of its existence.
How long can a car last? The most a car has survived is much more than your expectation. Read on to know!

headings.heading: Only 20% of the Energy in Gasoline Powers the Car
headings.content:
No process in the universe that includes converting energy from one form to another is 100% efficient. You will always lose some of the energy in the conversion process. However, gas-powered cars have ridiculously low efficiency.
It is true that gas engines can be made to have up to 50% thermal efficiency but normal road car engines can hardly top 25%. That, added to the fact that up to 20% of the energy is lost between the engine and the wheels, means only 20% of the chemical energy in the gas you fill in your car actually moves it, the rest is lost.

headings.heading: The Bugatti Chiron's Engine Can Power 55 Homes at Peak Load
headings.content:
Remember the Chiron, the four-wheeled piece of automotive engineering famous for ripping holes through time at staggering speeds? The engine that makes this feat possible for this machine is insanely powerful.
The W16 motor in this car spits out a formidable 1,500hp. Let's think of it this way: 1500hp equals 1,100 kilowatts and the average load energy load of a typical residence is 20kw, with all the appliances turned on. That means you can power more than 50 homes by mating a powerful enough generator to the W16 of a Chiron.

headings.heading: An F1 Car Generate Enough Aerodynamic Downforce to Drive Upside Down in Tunnel
headings.content:
F1 cars are very lightweight. The weight limit is 743 kg. To make sure that such a lightweight car stays glued to the track when cornering at 100mph, engineers use downforce. The car has a lot of surfaces that are designed to produce a force on the car. The principle is the same as in airplanes, but instead of lifting the car up, downforce pushes it down.
An F1 car can produce 750kgs of downforce at 100mph. This means that if you drive an F1 car upside down in a tunnel at 100mph, it can support its own load with the help of downforce.

headings.heading: There is a 1966 Volvo With 3,000,000 Miles on the Odometer
headings.content:
For most of us, the age of a car is 100,000 miles, 200,000 if it's a resilient Japanese car. That all pales in comparison to the most mileage a car has covered in one lifetime. A man named Irvin Gordon has a 1966 Volvo with more than 3,000,000 miles on the odometer.
As for the tips for making a car last long, Irvin said that he changed the engine oil every 3,000 miles and transmission oil every 25,000 miles. What's the most astonishing thing about Irvin's record-holding Volvo is that its stock clutch lasted 450,000 miles. The average life of a clutch is hardly 50,000 miles.
Do you like a new car's smell? You shouldn't. The reason for that is coming up!

headings.heading: The First Mass-Produced Car Was the Ford Model T
headings.content:
When cars appeared as a consumer product at the start of the 20th century, they were only made on order. Typically, a car company would only sell the chassis and engine and the buyer had to commission a coach maker to build the body.
It was not until 1908 that Henry Ford invented the assembly line and started mass-producing cars for the general public. The first car to roll out of the assembly line was the Ford Model T.

headings.heading: We are Making More than 78 Million Cars Every Year
headings.content:
Remember how we have more than 1.44 billion cars driving around the roads worldwide? Well, our production rate is equally astonishing. In 2020, 78 million new cars were made around the world.
Considering that more or less 2,400 lbs of metal are used to make an average car, 187 billion lbs of metal are used to make cars every year. Put together, all that steel will make a cube with each side measuring in at 735 feet.

headings.heading: The First Mass-Produced 4-Wheel-Drive Car was Jeep
headings.content:
It was the early 1940s when the US army realized they need a vehicle that can drive on any type of terrain. The product of that was Willy's Jeep of 1940. The initial purpose of this car was military use but it opened the path for generations of utilitarian vehicles.
The Willy's Jeep was such an amazing piece of machinery that you can still find these in working conditions, still conquering formidable terrains.

headings.heading: The Characteristic NEW CAR Smell is Made of 50 Chemicals
headings.content:
Everyone likes the smell of a new car, but it is not something to enjoy, rather one to stay away from. According to a recent study, the smell of a new car is a result of the volatile chemicals used in the production of the interior.
These consist of brominated flame retardants, chromium, and lead. All these substances are harmful to health and car manufacturers are looking for ways to eliminate this smell from new cars.
Find out what's special about Ronaldo's new car, coming up.

headings.heading: There's a Car With its Engine Sound Tuned  by Yamaha
headings.content:
The LFA is a Japanese supercar made by Toyota's brand Lexus. There are a lot of cool things about this car, but the sickest aspect of this machine is the sound it makes.
Toyota hired people from Yamaha to tune the car to have a perfect sound. As a matter of fact, it is the only production car that sounds like an F1 car. The sound is channeled through special structures and echoed inside the cockpit to give the driver an original feel of the engine as they drive.

headings.heading: The Most Expensive New Production Car Was Purchased by Ronaldo
headings.content:
When Bugatti revealed the La Voiture Noire (Black Car) at the Geneva International Motor Show in March 2019, it was branded the most good-looking car in the world, and it obviously had a price tag to match that.
Soccer player Christiano Ronaldo bought one of these last year. Ronaldo, who has a net worth of $500 million, paid a hefty sum of $10 million to add this car to his collection.

headings.heading: Bugatti was Recently Bought by an EV STARTUP
headings.content:
Remember we mentioned that Bugatti is no longer owned by Volkswagen? That's because Rimac Automobili, a 2009 EV startup from Croatia, has acquired a 55% stake in Bugatti. VW still owns the remaining 45% through Porsche, but Rimac is in control now.
Rimac has purchased this prestigious company to use the Bugatti name that's synonymous with speed. Moreover, this deal will give Porsche access to the EV research of Rimac and Rimac will have access to the superior engineering expertise of Porsche.

headings.heading: Most Lamborghinis are Named After Bulls
headings.content:
The founder of Automobili Lamborghini, Ferruccio Lamborghini, was inspired by his friend Don Eduardo Miura and his bulls. So, when he stepped into the supercar game, he wanted to pay tribute to the bulls by naming the cars after them.
The Miura, Huracan, and Aventador models are all named after bulls. The Espada was named after a famous bullfighter. The Urraco (meant to be a smaller model) literally means 'small bull.' Sesto Elemento, meaning the sixth element, is an anomaly - but that's a cool name nonetheless.
Can you name the driver of the car in space? That's what you're about to find out!

headings.heading: China has 10 Million More Cars Than the US
headings.content:
America historically had the most cars in the world but that changed in 2009 when it was surpassed by China. There are currently 286.9 million cars in the US and 297 million in China.
That's not a fair comparison though. The population of the US is 329.5 million, meaning there is a car for every 1.15 people in the US. China is home to 1.4 billion people, hence there is a car for every 4.7 people.

headings.heading: The Fastest a Car has Ever Gone is 763mph
headings.content:
This is the fastest car to ever be, except that it rides on skinny billet aluminum wheels with no tires and is powered by a jet engine. This is the Thrust SSC, a car made with the aim to go above 1000mph.
So far, this jet-engine powered car has managed to reach 763 mph in the Black Rock Desert. That location was selected because it's the only surface on the globe straight and flat enough for this absurdity. The team behind this thing is planning to strap an afterburner and a couple of rockets in the rear to make it go beyond 1000mph.

headings.heading: There is Currently a Passenger Car in Outer Space
headings.content:
What do you do if you have a car company and a space exploration company? You obviously put a car on a rocket and send it right to Mars. Oh, and do not forget to put a mannequin in the driving seat to freak out any aliens.
The Tesla Roadster that Elon Musk sent to Mars was used as a dummy payload for the Falcon Heavy Rocket. It, however, strayed from the path. As of now, it is 17.3 million miles from the Red Planet, moving at 20,189 mph. That makes it the fastest production car, technically.

headings.heading: 80% of Your Car Might Have Been Another Car in the Past
headings.content:
Cars are made of a variety of different materials. They have everything from metal to fabric and everything in between. The good thing about cars is that as much as 80% of all the materials used in a car are recyclable.
That means, your brand new Mercedes might have been a VW Beetle back in the day or a Lamborghini's engine might contain aluminum from a former Corolla. However, it is good for the planet and we should recycle as much as possible.
You can buy a new car for as low as $2,700. Keep reading to know more!

headings.heading: Most of the Cars in the World are White
headings.content:
A red Ferrari is the dream car for a lot of people, but what most people prefer is a plain white car. Around 29% of all the cars sold in the world are white. That is followed, in order, by black, grey, and silver.
White is the most preferred color because white cars tend to have more resale value and white color does not fade as much as others due to the action of sunlight and other environmental factors.

headings.heading: The Beetle Was Developed on Hitler's Orders
headings.content:
When Adolf Hitler realized that Americans have a lot of cars, he wanted to make that possible for Germans too. He commissioned Ferdinand Porsche to develop a car for the average German.
The result was Volkswagen (people's car) Beetle. Many decades later, the Beetle is still considered an icon of the 1930s to 1960s. It is an affordable, reliable, and practical car that made personal mobility possible for a lot of people.

headings.heading: The World's Cheapest Car Costs $2,750
headings.content:
Ratan Tata, the same guy who owns Jaguar Land Rover Limited started what can be called the most ambitious affordable car project of the world in 2008. The aim was to make a car that would cost 100,000 ($1,600) Indian Rupees.
That turned out to be too ambitious, and the car debuted with a starting price of 200,000 INR ($2,700). Since cost-saving is the theme of this car, it comes with a tiny 2-cylinder engine, three lug nuts on a wheel, and very limited safety features. But you can only complain so much about a sub $3,000 car.

headings.heading: Cars Produce 75% of Carbon Monoxide
headings.content:
The combustion process that makes a car's engine work produces carbon dioxide as a by-product. While that gas is a huge environmental concern on its own, what's even more dangerous is carbon monoxide; another by-product of the process.
It is estimated that 75% of all carbon monoxide produced by the US comes from cars. This gas is poisonous and can even be fatal. If you run a car engine for too long in a closed space, the carbon monoxide levels can get lethal. I'm not sure if you'd known this but Frank Underwood from House of Cards definitely did!

headings.heading: Dubai Has the World's Fastest Police Cars
headings.content:
Dubai is known for a lot of crazy things but what's the most amazing of them is the fact that cops in this city don't drive an average car. Instead, they have the fastest sports cars to chase criminals.
The police have all the famous sports cars in their fleet from the Lamborghini Aventador to Audi R8. They even have a Bugatti Chiron in their use. So if you are in Dubai, be sure to check the car of the cops before deciding to run from them.

headings.heading: A Car is Made for Every Two Babies Born Every Day
headings.content:
We are making new cars at a staggering rate. Every single day, 165,000 cars roll out off the assembly lines of automakers all over the world. But, how many cars are 165,000? Well, here's some perspective.
The total number of babies born in the world every day is 385,000 per day. That means, for every two babies that come into the world, one car is made.

headings.heading: Ferrari Manages to Crank Out Just 14 Cars a Day
headings.content:
We've talked about how Toyota sells a Corolla every 15 seconds and how we are making 78 million cars a year, but how about the top-tier car makers? Out of the 165,000 cars made a day, just 14 are Ferraris.
It's not because Ferrari cannot make more cars. It is because, in order to keep the value of the cars high, they have to keep the supply low so that people are forced to pay the premium price. That's Economics 101!

headings.heading: BMW South Africa Once Offered Flame Throwers
headings.content:
In the late 1990s, carjackings got so common in South Africa that BMW had to resort to military-grade weapons. For $600, you could have your car fitted with flamethrowers on both sides.
If someone's about to rob you, all you need to do is to press a button from inside the car and it will roast the thug into barbecue right then and there, no questions asked.

headings.heading: You are More Likely to Die in a Car Crash Than From a Snake Bite
headings.content:
According to the National Safety Council, if you are involved in a car accident, there is a 1 in 107 chance that you'll not make out of it alive. Those are not very good odds, but do you know they are very, very worse than surviving a snake bite?
The chances of dying of snakebite, in the US, are next to zero, thanks to the excellent healthcare and availability of antivenoms. Each year 7-8,000 cases of snake bites are reported and the probability of dying if you are bit by a snake is one in 50 million.

title: Renewed Or Canceled? The Status Of Popular Shows Across Streaming Platforms And Networks
intro:
Gather round;  it's time to learn which television shows have been renewed for a new season and which ones are getting the boot and have been canceled. 
From the renewal of The Boys and The Crown to the cancelation of Chilling Adventures of Sabrina and Schitt's Creek, there are bound to be some happy and sad tears while going through this list.

headings.heading: The Crown: Renewed
headings.content: The period series The Crown has viewers pretty entranced. A critically award-winning series, the show covers the inner workings of the royal family when Queen Elizabeth II takes the throne, including the drama between Princess Diana and Prince Charles.With 117 awards to its name, it's no surprise that Netflix decided to renew the series for a fifth season.Stay tuned to learn the fate of Cobra Kai.

headings.heading: Bridgerton: Renewed
headings.content:
The Netflix original series Bridgerton pretty much became an overnight sensation. Following the love stories of the eight Brigerton children in the Regency era in England, fans couldn't get enough of the drama, love, and re-imagining of the period.
Due to the show's popularity, Netflix has renewed the show for a second season.

headings.heading: White Lines: Canceled
headings.content:
Unfortunately for people who were intrigued by the mystery surrounding Zoe Walker's brother's death in Ibiza, the journey is getting cut short.
After one ten-episode season of White Lines, the powers that be have decided to cancel the show, not renewing the thriller series for another season on Netflix's streaming platform.

headings.heading: The Boys: Renewed
headings.content:
When The Boys first found its way on to Amazon Prime in 2019, the series soon became all of the rage -- superheroes fighting against the organization that wishes to control them.
Fans are going to be happy to learn that the critically acclaimed series isn't going anywhere, having been renewed for a third season.

headings.heading: Cobra Kai: Renewed
headings.content:
Getting its start as nothing more than a YouTube show, Cobra Kai has made quite the name for itself. Starring the guys from the Karate Kid, the series brings back Daniel LaRusso and Johnny Lawrence to battle it out (or, their students do) to see whose dojo is the best.
The show became widely popular when it dropped on Netflix. So much so that after three seasons, the streaming giant has decided to renew it for a fourth.
Stay tuned to learn which creek is coming to an end.

headings.heading: Better Call Saul: Renewed
headings.content:
The origin story of crooked lawyer Saul Goodman is laid out for Breaking Bad fans in the spin-off series Better Call Saul. After learning how Jimmy "Saul Goodman" goes from a terrible lawyer to a criminal lawyer isn't just interesting, but intense as he mingles with the other side of the law.
Renewed for another season, there's no telling what is in store for Saul.
Coming up: The status of Virgin River.

headings.heading: Chilling Adventures Of Sabrina: Canceled
headings.content:
In 2018, fans were reintroduced to Sabrina Spellman in Chilling Adventures of Sabrina. Sadly, Sabrina's adventures of huddling being a half-mortal half-witch have come to an end after four seasons.
According to Netflix, the cancelation of the show came as one of many "unrenewed shows" during Hollywood's production mishap of 2020.

headings.heading: Black Mirror: Renewed
headings.content:
The modern-day Twilight Zone, Black Mirror, has been renewed for another season. An anthology of weird, quirky, and all-around mind-blowing episodes dealing with technology and the human experience isn't going anywhere.
Since there have already been five seasons of the series, it's going to be insane to see what the writers come up with next.

headings.heading: Transparent: Canceled
headings.content:
The term dysfunctional family takes on a whole new meaning in the comedy series Transparent. For Mort and his children, their stories are about to go back in their vaults because, after five seasons, Transparent has been canceled.
After allegations were made against one of the main actors, it was decided the show's fifth season was going to be its last.

headings.heading: Schitt's Creek: Canceled
headings.content:
The Rose family didn't know what they were in for when they lost all of their money and had to move away from their luxurious mansion to the small town of Schitt's Creek. Fans also didn't know what they were in for when they decided to follow the hilarious stories of Moira, Johnny, Alexis, and Stevie.
Sadly, their story on the creek has ended, and the series had a sixth and final season.
The cancelation of this upcoming series was directly on the heels of Anna Ferris's departure.

headings.heading: Snowpiercer: Renewed
headings.content:
Aboard a high-speed train circling the frozen wasteland of a globe, the survivors are trying their hardest to stay alive in Snowpiercer. Continuing where Boon Joon-ho cult classic film left off, this series had a shaky start to production.
Thankfully, everything paid off, and it is now being renewed for a fourth season.

headings.heading: Emily In Paris: Renewed
headings.content:
Lily Collins plays the title character of Emily in the popular Netflix series Emily in Paris. Moving from Chicago to the romantic city of Paris to work and, ultimately, find love, this series became an overnight sensation.
The good news for the fanbase is Emily and her friends aren't going anywhere, as the series has been renewed for another season.

headings.heading: Patriot Act with Hasan Minhaj: Canceled
headings.content:
The talk show Patriot Act with Hasan Minhaj gained widespread attention for the host's discussion of the political landscape while throwing some hints of satire into the mix.
Unfortunately, after six seasons, the "groundbreaking" talk show has been canceled. It sounds like Netflix is still working on its original talk show programming.

headings.heading: Sex Education: Renewed
headings.content:
Otis and his mother Jean are back and more educated than ever in the renewal of the critically acclaimed series Sex Education. Life is never boring for Otis, living with a sex therapist mother who is all too ready to educate him on the finer forms of being an adult.
Fun, funny, and yet pretty realistically dramatic, fans of this series better get ready for the fourth season!

headings.heading: Narcos: Mexico: Canceled
headings.content:
A spin-off of the original Narcos series, Narcos: Mexico, takes viewers back to the origins of the war on drugs between the head of the Guadalajara Cartel and the ever-present Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA).
Sadly, the fast-paced action has been canceled. On October 28, 2020, it was announced that the third season of Narcos: Mexico would be the last.

headings.heading: Titans: Renewed
headings.content:
Based on the Teen Titians comic books, Titans follows the story of Dick Grayson as he and his fellow heroes and sidekicks fight against evil in various cities, including Gotham City, Detroit, and even San Francisco.
The live-action reimagining of the DC characters has been well received, enough for HBO to renew the show for another season.

headings.heading: Into The Badlands: Canceled
headings.content:
AMC's series Into the Badlands attempted to take the concept of a post-apocalyptic landscape and throw some really cool martial arts into the mix. While it captured viewers' attention for a while, it wasn't enough for AMC to renew for another season.
As it turned out, the third season was the series last.

headings.heading: Virgin River: Renewed
headings.content:
Nurse practitioner Melinda "Mel" Monroe moves from the big city to the remote Northern California town of Virgin River in the drama series Virgin River. Considered "comfort viewing," the series has a remarkable 90% on Rotten Tomatoes after three seasons.
In 2021, it was announced that the show was going to be renewed for a fourth and fifth season.

headings.heading: Ozark: Renewed
headings.content:
In 2017, viewers became increasingly addicted to the crazy life of Marty Byrde, a financial planner and money-launderer. After a few missteps, he finds himself on the wrong side of some very powerful drug lords.
His tale is a crazy one, one that has been renewed for a two-part fourth season.

headings.heading: Yellowstone: Renewed
headings.content:
Fans of Yellowstone were relieved to learn that the hit series has been officially renewed for Season 5. Paramount kept quiet about whether or not they would film another season, but executive producer David Glasser told Variety that the new season will likely debut in Fall 2022.
That means Cole Hauser and the rest of the cast will return to reprise their roles, as actors Kevin Costner, Luke Grimes, Kelly Reilly, Wes Bentley and more confirmed their return.

headings.heading: Mom: Canceled
headings.content:
The story of Christy and Bonnie Plunkett left viewers laughing at the wholesome and funny mother and daughter dynamic. Starring Anna Farris and Allison Janney, the sitcom Mom ran strong for eight seasons before it was canceled.
The cancelation came on the heels of Farris's departure from the show in 2020.

headings.heading: Lucifer: Canceled
headings.content:
The devil is in the details, and this devil is finally going to figure out what he should do with his life in the final season of Lucifer. After saving the series from an early cancelation, Netflix picked it up and set it on a new path -- with Lucifer winning the throne and becoming God.
Now, Lucier's story in Los Angeles has come to an end with the sixth season.
Coming up soon: the fate of Walker.

headings.heading: The Witcher: Renewed
headings.content:
Good news for fantasy fans, The Witcher is renewed for another season. After a bumpy start to the series, the legend of Geralt of Rivia and Princess Ciri is back and ready for some mind-blowing adventure.
Even with mixed reviews of the first season, Netflix is set on releasing a second season.

headings.heading: Glow: Canceled
headings.content:
The glitter, spandex, and ring are coming to an end. The comedy series Glow had a stellar three-season run, full of laughter, fighting, and '80s hair. Ruth Wilder and the other Hollywood misfits had a nice run in the ring, but 2020 saw production shut down.
Instead of moving forward with the final season the studio reopened, Netflix decided to cancel the final fourth season.

headings.heading: The Last Kingdom: Renewed
headings.content:
A story of loyalty and blood, The Last Kingdom follows Uhtred as he is dealt one blow after another and soon has to decide whether or not he should avenge his home country and family or the ones who took him in -- his late father's enemy.
Now, it's time to see how it all ends, as the series has been renewed for a fifth and final season.

headings.heading: Walker: Renewed
headings.content:
A revival of the 1990s series Walker, Texas Ranger, Walker has Jared Padalecki in the title role as he reconnects with his son and daughter while learning about the suspicious circumstances surrounding his wife's murder.
Even though viewers complained about the lack of action, The CW has renewed Walker for a second season.
This Is Us has been renewed but only for one more season. Keep reading to learn more.

headings.heading: Grace And Frankie: Renewed
headings.content:
Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin star in the hit sitcom Grace and Frankie. The show follows the lives of the two older women as they get thrown together after their husbands leave them for each other.
A hysterical show about two unexpecting friends, the series has been renewed for one final laugh-out-loud season.

headings.heading: A.P. Bio: Canceled
headings.content:
Jack Griffin gets fired from his job at Harvard only to find himself back in his hometown teaching A.P. Bio. Starring Glenn Howerton, A.P. Bio is a hysterical series with the teacher exploiting his honors students for his own gain.
Even though critics complain about the stereotypical tropes used throughout the series, it was still renewed for a fourth season.

headings.heading: Saved By The Bell: Renewed
headings.content:
Not the 1990s Saved by the Bell, but the 2020 revival of the same name is being renewed for another season. Back at Bayview High School, a new generation of students is making their way through adolescence.
It's sure to be fun viewing the drama and silly antics the students muster up in the new season.

headings.heading: Space Force: Renewed
headings.content:
Headed by Steve Carell, Space Force is the comedy show that is pretty much an entire spoof on the United States Space Force. Following the group of people tasked with making the military branch, the show is a bucket of laughs.
Even with its mixed reviews, Netflix enjoys the concept and cast, renewing the show for a second season.

headings.heading: This Is Us: Renewed
headings.content:
There might be an uproar if the critically acclaimed series This Is Us wasn't renewed for another season! The popular series is all about family drama which, as it turns out, people love to watch!
In 2021, it was announced that the series would be renewed for a sixth and final season.

title: Behind-The-Scenes Facts Of Flea Market Flip And Its Host, Lara Spencer
intro:
Behind the hustle, bustle, and creativity of Flea Market Flip, there are behind-the-scenes facts about the HGTV show that some fans might not know. Even though the design show has been on since 2012, how many people actually know that host Lara Spencer works on various news outlets? Or that each episode takes three days to shoot?
Don't worry, though; there are more fun facts below; keep reading!

headings.heading: Off-Camera Browsing Happens Before The Cameras Roll
headings.content: While it might look as though contestants are seeing a flea market layout for the first time while running around on camera, that's not entirely true.Before the cameras begin rolling, the teams are allowed one hour to browse the flea market and scope out the furniture they'd like to purchase with their $500.Host Lara Spencer has a favorite item from the show. It's coming up soon!

headings.heading: It Takes Three Days To Shoot One Episode
headings.content:
According to season four, episode seven winners, Sarah and John Trop, it takes a solid three days to shoot one episode of Flea Market Flip. The first day is the "shopping day," where the contestants run around various flea markets looking for furniture.
The second day is "building day," and the final day of filming is "selling day." It's all very organized!

headings.heading: Contestants Have A World Of Help In The Workshop
headings.content:
When Flea Market Flip constants make their way to the workshop, they're paired up with a "helper." But viewers might not realize that these carpenters do a boatload of work redesigning the flea market purchases.
According to former contestant Charlotte Smith, she and her partner never could have made their design a reality without the help of Cija.

headings.heading: An Antique Bike Turned Tavern Table Was Spencer's Favorite Flip
headings.content:
As Flea Market Flip aired on HGTV from 2012-2019, it's safe to say host Lara Spencer has seen some pretty funky creations in her time. But, when it comes down to it, there is one flip that totally blew her mind.
In one episode, a  team took an antique bicycle and completely transformed it into a chic tavern table. According to Spencer, "It was one of a kind."
Coming up soon: read about how Lara Spencer became so knowledgeable about flipping.

headings.heading: Most Of The Contestants Are Related
headings.content:
No, there isn't a rule that says all of the contestants who go on the HGTV show Flea Market Flip need to be related or married. But it just so happens that most of them are!
There have been multiple sibling teams as well as mother and daughter duos and even father and son pairings.

headings.heading: There Are No Plans For New Episodes
headings.content:
The last new episode of Flea Market Flip aired back in July 2019. But due to the HGTV show's immense popularity, fans were speculating whether or not Lara Spencer would move forward with a new season.
During an exclusive interview with PopCulture, Spencer said that she has no future plans for the series and, right now, is focusing on her hew series Everything But the House.

headings.heading: Trash Talk Is A Big Part Of The Show's Competitive Nature
headings.content:
Throughout the years, Lara Spencer has noticed that the competitive nature of Flea Market Flip has become more and more intense. People are coming on to the show with a lot of skill and creativity, some of which they got from watching previous episodes!
Because of this, friendly trash talk has become a big part of the series.

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Is A Successful News Anchor
headings.content:
Lara Spencer might host the HGTV show Flea Market Flip, but that doesn't mean it's her only job. In fact, Spencer is a successful news anchor, having worked for various outlets throughout her career.
From 2004 to 2011, Spencer was the host of The Insider, and she's also contributed to The Early Show. Aside from that, she's been working as a correspondent for Good Morning America since 1999!

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Learned About Flipping From Her Mother
headings.content:
Since Lara Spencer is the host of Flea Market Flip and the proud author of two books, it's safe to say she knows a thing or two about finding a diamond in the rough and repurposing it into something completely new and creative.
Spencer actually learned the skill of flipping from her mother!

headings.heading: Flea Market Vendors Have To Sign Waviers
headings.content:
During Flea Market Flip, it might look as though the contestants are in hardcore negotiations with the vendors. But that's not exactly the case. Each vendor has to sign a waiver saying they're okay being on TV and showcasing their products.
So, everyone onscreen pretty much already knows what's about to happen during an episode.
Fans sometimes swarm the flea markets where filming takes place. How do they know where to go? The answer is coming up soon.

headings.heading: They Have A Few Days To Make A Building Plan
headings.content:
Watching Flea Market Flip, it looks as though contestants only have a day to figure out what they want to build out of their purchase. In all actuality, this isn't the case.
According to former contestant Charlotte Smith, she and her partner Jill had a solid four days between their initial purchase and actually getting into the workshop.

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Designed Kathy Griffin's Home
headings.content:
Aside from being a TV journalist, the host of Flea Market Flip, and the author of two books, Lara Spencer does a bit of interior designing in her spare time. In fact, she has some pretty big-name celebrities going to her for her input.
She even designed comedian Kathy Griffin's home!

headings.heading: Contestants Get To Flex Their Acting Skills
headings.content:
When it comes to Flea Market Flip, so much is happening at once that the film crew might miss a key component of a team's shopping or building day.
That means the contestants have to go back in time and reenact something the crew found interesting or important even though, technically speaking, it had already happened.

headings.heading: Episodes Aren't Filmed In Order
headings.content:
Watching Flea Market Flip, there is a very precise order of events: the contestants shop, build and resell. Interestingly enough, this isn't exactly how everything is filmed. Some scenes are actually filmed out of order.
According to former contestants, "...our post-selling interview was very down. Lara arrived to shoot her scenes with us, and we were feeling bummed, but we had to perk up and film all of the scenes for the day, including getting set up and pretending the day hadn't happened yet."
"Seasoned pickers" don't enjoy one aspect of being on the show. Their pet peeve is coming up soon, so keep reading!

headings.heading: Lara Spencer's Net Worth: $20 Million
headings.content:
Between her TV journalism career on Good Morning America, two books, and hosting various television series such as Flea Market Flip, Lara Spencer has quite a resume that has brought her some serious cash.
At the peak of her hosting career, Spencer was bringing in a solid $3 million per year. As of 2021, her net worth is $20 Million.

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Authored Two Books About Flea Markets
headings.content:
While Lara Spencer is known for her lengthy resume full of TV journalism, she has other passions that align pretty seamlessly with her role as host of Flea Market Flip. As of 2021, Spencer has authored two books, both revolving around the topic of second-hand furniture.
I Brake for Yard Sales: and Flea Markets, Thrift Shops, Auctions, and the Occasional Dumpster was published in 2012, and Flea Market Fabulous: Designing Gorgeous Rooms with Vintage Treasures was published in 2014.

headings.heading: Sometimes Fans Know Which Flea Markets Will Be Showcased
headings.content:
HGTV knows that Flea Market Flip has a solid fanbase. So, they do something every once and a while to keep that fanbase happy -- they spill which flea market they are going to be filming at!
A majority of the time, the network will let people know via their Instagram account.

headings.heading: The Show Won A Daytime Emmy Award For Best Lifestyle Program
headings.content:
Since its debut in 2012, Flea Market Flip with host Lara Spencer has been one of HGTV's most popular programs. It was solidified how popular in 2017 when the series walked away with a Daytime Emmy Award for the Best Lifestyle Program on television.
Not too bad for a fast-paced restoration series!

headings.heading: A "Seasoned Picker" Wasn't Fond Of Waiting Around
headings.content:
Contestants don't arrive at the selected flea market right when it opens, something that kind of aggravates "seasoned pickers." According to them, waiting around is literally a waste of time since all of the good items tend to go early.
One former contestant even had to calm her mom, a seasoned picker down, telling her that there'd still be items waiting around!

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Has Hosted Other Antique Shows
headings.content:
Lara Spencer is a flipping genius and loves antiques, roadshows, and flea markets. In fact, she's hosted various other television series throughout her career, not including Flea Market Flip.
Throughout the 2004 and 2005 seasons, Spencer hosted Antiques Roadshow. Then, in 2005, she hosted a spin-off series called Antiques Roadshow FYI.

headings.heading: There Is A $100 "Extras" Budget
headings.content:
Flea Market Flip contestants are given $500 to spend in the selected flea market, picking out and haggling with vendors as they see fit. Of course, the less money they spend, the better in the long run!
But there is another budget they are given. Contestants get $100 for "extras," such as paint.

headings.heading: Lara Spencer Created A Game Show
headings.content:
While Lara Spencer is definitely known for her work on Flea Market Flip and as a news anchor for popular programs like Good Morning America, she is also very creative.
In 2011 she created a game show called It's Worth What? Unfortunately, after a single season of nine episodes, the show was canceled.

title: The Unexpected Reason Why A Dryer Sheet Might Appear In Your Mailbox
intro: In spring 2021, some people have been finding dryer sheets inside of their mailboxes. Others intentionally put these sheets in their mailbox. Why are they putting them there? Although it seems like an underground message or prank, the surprisingly simple reason was revealed on Reddit. Learn why people across the U.S. put dryer sheets in their mailboxes.

headings.heading: Who Is Placing Dryer Sheets In Mailboxes?
headings.content: Throughout the country, people have reported seeing a dryer sheet in their mailbox. Some warily removed it, only to find that it was a regular dryer sheet. Others left it as is.These dryer sheets have raised many questions. Who was putting it there? Was it some strange prank for the internet?Soon, you'll see where the answer appeared on Reddit.

headings.heading: They Appear At The Same Time Every Year
headings.content:
Oddly, the dryer sheets would only appear during certain months. In most places, the dryer sheets popped up in mailboxes during May and June.
Whoever is putting dryer sheets in mailboxes only does it during spring, at least in the U.S. But what reason could they possibly have? Why didn't they appear during winter?

headings.heading: The Answer Appeared On Reddit, Of All Places
headings.content:
To many peoples' surprise, the answer appeared on Reddit in April 2021. There, user u/istrx13 posted on the "You Should Know" subreddit. The subreddit shares facts and tips that people "should know" to improve their lives.
Some of the advice includes "Sikh temples can provide a free meal" and "Yellowstone is not 'overdue' for an eruption." But this post was a little different.
Coming up: why postal workers are putting the sheets there.

headings.heading: Apparently, Postal Workers Put Them There
headings.content:
The user's post was titled, "YSK (You should know) if you randomly see a dryer sheet in the back of your mailbox, your mail carrier put it there for a reason."
That's right. Postmen are putting dryer sheets in mailboxes for some reason. As you might have guessed, this caught a lot of peoples' attention.

headings.heading: Why They Put It There
headings.content:
According to the user, mailmen put dryer sheets in mailboxes to deter yellowjackets and wasps. These insects usually become active in spring when the weather warms, and they build nests in mailboxes.
"So please, if you one day randomly see a dryer sheet at the back of your mailbox, just know that your carrier more than likely put it there to deter these Satanic creatures from building their home in it," the user wrote.
If you're wondering who made the post, you'll find out soon.

headings.heading: Was The Post Fake?
headings.content:
The post quickly garnered attention, gaining over 59,000 upvotes and 1,400 comments. But the attention also attracted skepticism.
Although the poster introduced himself with "Letter Carrier here," many questioned whether he was a real mailman. Other postal workers claimed that they did not do this and doubted that it would work.

headings.heading: He Revealed Himself On TODAY
headings.content:
A few weeks after the post went live, the user was contacted by TODAY. As it turns out, he was a real postman--Chris Strickley.
Strickley has worked in the postal service for six years. Five years ago, he moved from Oregon to Idaho. There, he discovered the dryer sheet hack.
Coming up: why postal workers are so afraid of insects in the mailbox.

headings.heading: At First, Strickley Was Also Confused
headings.content:
During his first year on the job, Strickley was also confused by the dryer sheet phenomenon. "I began to see dryer sheets in people's mailboxes at the start of spring," he recalled.
"At first, I was confused but just left them in there." But later, he discovered something when he returned to the post office.

headings.heading: But All Of His Coworkers Were Using Dryer Sheets
headings.content:
Later in his shift, Strickley realized that "my supervisor had a box of them on their desk." His coworkers were taking some sheets as they passed by the desk.
That was when Strickley asked his supervisor about the sheets. "[I] found out they are a good deterrent for wasps and yellowjackets," he told TODAY. "Ever since then, they're a normal part of my spring and summer."

headings.heading: Wasps Are A Huge Issue For Postal Workers
headings.content:
Wasps and yellowjackets are a dangerous issue for postal workers. Because of the dark mailbox and tiny nests, many do not see the insects.
"I can't tell you how many times, especially during this part of the year, where I’ve opened up a box to see a little nest with 3-5 Yellowjackets just chillin'," Strickley wrote on Reddit.
If you want to know why this trick supposedly works, stay tuned.

headings.heading: Strickley Had Been Stung Multiple Times
headings.content:
On his original Reddit post, Strickley claimed that yellowjackets and wasps frequently injure postmen. "If I'm really unlucky, they will have made their nest at the very back of the box so I wind up sticking my hand in not knowing they are there," he wrote.
"Last year alone, I was stung ten times on ten separate occasions." These stings can remain swollen for a week.

headings.heading: Why Does This Trick Work?
headings.content:
Strickley claimed that wasps and yellowjackets "hate scented dryer sheets." Postal workers put these sheets in mailboxes to prevent insects from entering.
Many dryer sheets are scented with essential oils like lavender and Moroccan oils. Most contain various chemicals that can be unhealthy for people with asthma, but only if you use them for clothes.
Coming soon: Does the U.S. Postal Service have official rules about dryer sheets?

headings.heading: How You Can Do It
headings.content:
When asked what kind of dryer sheets he uses, Strickley explained that the brand doesn't matter. "The scent seems to be what deters them. So any scented dryer sheet should suffice!" he wrote.
You should also replace the dryer sheet occasionally. When the sheet loses its scent, swap it out, said Strickley.

headings.heading: It Won't Work If Insects Are Already In There
headings.content:
Strickley emphasized that the dryer sheet hack is a "preventative measure." If a wasp nest is already in the mailbox, putting a dryer sheet in won't work (and could also get you stung).
"I've never tried when there’s a huge nest so I have no idea if it would work," Strickley wrote. Put the sheet in before insects invade your mailbox.

headings.heading: This Is Not An Official Postmen Rule
headings.content:
Although Strickley's supervisor provided dryer sheets, this is not an official rule. A spokesperson for the U.S. Postal Service told TODAY that not everyone does this.
"The social media post you are referring to is not a specific instruction or directive from the Postal Service," they explained. But they do have other insect-related guidelines.
Up next: What to do if you find wasps in your mailbox.

headings.heading: Postal Workers Might Warn You About A Nest
headings.content:
According to the U.S. Postal Service spokesperson, postal workers are required to report insect nests inside of mailboxes. They also must report the nest to their supervisor, who will try to contact the homeowner to get the nest removed.
In his post, Strickley said that he will tape a note to the homeowner's door to warn them. But not every employee will do that.

headings.heading: What To Do If Wasps Are In Your Mailbox
headings.content:
If you find insects in your mailbox, attach a note on top of it. Postal workers are trained to check the inside before reaching in, but it might be too dark to see the nest.
Contact your landlord immediately, or if you are the owner, call pest control. Do not try to remove the nest yourself.
Coming up: Why dryer sheet scents work but other smells don't.

headings.heading: But The Postal Service Does Have Preventative Measures
headings.content:
Although the Postal Service does not provide dryer sheets, they have guidelines to prevent insect stings. For instance, postal workers cannot wear perfume or shaving cream with scents that might attract insects.
Sweetened foods and drinks can attract bees, so the Postal Service warns against those. They also permit employees to use insecticide as needed.

headings.heading: Why Do Insects Enter The Mailbox?
headings.content:
Wasps and yellowjackets will build their nests just about anywhere, as long as it has a sturdy base and some protection for their young. Many people find nests on their overhangs and porches.
Insects might choose the mailbox because it is shaded, sheltered, and unwavering. If you see a lot of insects swarming your mailbox, they might be making a nest.

headings.heading: Don't Take The Sheets Out Of The Mailbox
headings.content:
In his Reddit post, Strickley advised people not to remove the dryer sheet if they find one in their mailbox. Know that postmen put them in as a precaution.
"I've had to put dryer sheets in a few different boxes on my route and the customers have been removing them," he said in a comment. "So I just wanted to make a PSA."

headings.heading: How Do Dryer Sheets Work If Other Scents Are Banned?
headings.content:
The Postal Service discourages "flowery" scents that attract bees and wasps. If these scents attract insects, why do dryer sheets repel them?
Dryer sheets have a variety of scents, many of which come from chemicals, which might make them different. However, this confusion has led some experts to doubt Strickley's life hack.
Stay tuned to learn why some scientists say the hack will backfire.

headings.heading: Does The Dryer Sheet Hack Work?
headings.content:
Entomologist Sonja L. Swiger told TODAY that there have been no studies about dryer sheets and insects. Beyond anecdotes, there is no proof that scented dryer sheets repel insects.
Although Sonja said that the hack is possibly effective, she also stated, "The science does not add up and it would seem that if this was a viable option there would be more discussion on it."

headings.heading: Some Scientists Say That It Could Backfire
headings.content:
Dr. Qing-He Zhang, the Director of Research at Sterling International, believes that the dryer sheet hack might not work. In fact, it could even attract insects.
Zhang claimed that insects might enjoy the "flower-like" smell. "[It is] highly unlikely that yellowjackets would be repelled by the perfume-y smell of the dryer sheets," he wrote in a 2013 blog post.
Up next: why the brand might matter after all.

headings.heading: But There Is Also Some Evidence For It
headings.content:
Despite Zhang's claim, there is some evidence to support the dryer sheet hack. In 2013, a study in Pest Management Science discovered that a combination of essential oils deterred yellowjackets.
This particular combination was rosemary, geranium, lemongrass, and clove. A similar scent might keep yellowjackets away, as Strickley had claimed.

headings.heading: Despite What Strickley Said, The Brand Might Matter
headings.content:
When WUSA9 News caught wind of the post, they reached out to David Mizejewski with the Naturalist with the National Wildlife Federation. He was skeptical of Strickley's advice.
"There are many brands of dryer sheets and surely they're not all made with the exact same ingredients," Mizejewski said. "What ingredients in a dryer sheet would have a repellent effect? Why haven’t pest control companies capitalized on this ingredient?"

headings.heading: This Is Not The First Time People Used This Hack
headings.content:
Strickley is not the only person to bring up the dryer sheet hack on social media. In 2019, Facebook user Staci Hoppes posted a photo of a dryer sheet in her mailbox for a similar reason.
Instead of repelling wasps, she said that the sheets ward off ants. She told TODAY that is has worked for ants, but she hasn't tested it on other insects.
You might be surprised how much dryer sheets can make a difference in your home's cleanliness, freshness, and functionality. Keep going for hacks that will truly put a bounce in your step.

headings.heading: No Need To Buy Air Fresheners Any More
headings.content:
Dryer sheets smell fantastic, which is why we always stick our faces into our warm laundry when it comes fresh out of the dryer and take a big sniff. So why stop at freshening your clothes? Dryer sheets are the perfect replacement for air fresheners and all you need is a fan to do it.
